Name: Amriti Mohith
universityAnswer: University of Queensland, Chemical and Bioprocess Engineering, 4th year
whyStudyAnswer: I chose chemical engineering because I want to have a positive impact on the environment and society. There is only so much you can do as an individual in regards to trying to address the global issue of leaving a carbon footprint. This led me to want to work directly at the top of the production chain as a chemical engineer and tackle problems related to decarbonization and sustainability.
whyRobogalsAnswer: As someone who grew up in Africa, I have witnessed and experienced gender discrimination firsthand on numerous occasions. Growing up in such an environment showed me the importance of supporting women's empowerment in a community. For this reason, my goal is to advocate and motivate young girls to explore their potential in STEM through Robogals.
